favourite.article: Thank you so much brother for including this hymn, we certainly have to let our struggle, to Thee comit my way, we must trust on His word and on HIs will. Praise The Lord!!!!

The title of this song drew me in; the words are o-so-very-very timely. In the wrestling match of questions, in the aftermath of trauma, in the midst of "WHY? O DEAR LORD WHY?" , these lyrics from long ago bring comfort to me today. Thank you so much for including them.

While I was singing this hymn I considered it to be so general in its subject to "settle it all." Yet singing it in the Lord's presence, it became so specific. It could point to my hidden sin, my worldly pleasures, my resistance to serve the Lord, or even to my unwillingness to mend things with another person. As I continued singing, I knew what I needed to settle before the Lord. "Lord, I give up the struggle, to Thee commit my way."
